Key Arguments: The bill is seen as a violation of freedom of speech and expression.
The definitions of misinformation and disinformation are vague and could lead to misuse of power.
The bill grants excessive power to ACMA without sufficient oversight.
The bill could erode public trust and has potential negative implications for the legal system.
The bill is perceived as an attempt by the government to control information dissemination.
Notable Quotes: The mere suggestion of The Bill is an insult to the intelligence of Australians.
This bill’s proposal represents a flagrant violation of the right to freedom of expression as enshrined in the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights.
The government's stated intention to ‘protect’ Australians and ‘maintain democracy’ does not require such a bill.
The suggestions made by this bill are intolerable, and indeed should not be tolerated by any Australian who values fundamental human rights.
